alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Blanco; Edwards; Gillespie; Kendall; Kerr; Real (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 25 at 8:50PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH 1 PM THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bandera, Blanco, Burnet, Edwards, Gillespie, Kendall, Kerr, Llano and Real. * WHEN...Through 1 PM Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A very moist an unstable airmass over Texas has resulted from an approaching disturbance from the west and the influx of moisture from the remnants of a tropical cyclone. Moderate to heavy rain is possible late this evening continuing into late Thursday morning. Rainfall totals of 1 to 3 inches with isolated 4 to 6 inches are possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bandera; Blanco; Edwards; Gillespie; Kendall; Kerr; Real
